title: How to Make Horseradish Mustard

steps.headline: Place all of the ingredients into a food processor or blender.
Process or blend until smooth.
steps.description: The ingredients should form a paste.

steps.headline: Scoop the paste into a suitable, sterilized jar.
Store in the refrigerator.
steps.description: Let the mustard sit for 2 weeks before using, so that it improves in flavor. Label and date the jar.

text: Horseradish mustard 1 Place all of the ingredients into a food processor or blender.  Process or blend until smooth. The ingredients should form a paste. Scoop the paste into a suitable, sterilized jar. Seal. Store in the refrigerator. Let the mustard sit for 2 weeks before using, so that it improves in flavor. Label and date the jar. Horseradish mustard 2 Add the ground mustard seeds and water to a bowl. Mix to form a paste. Place the vinegar, onion, garlic, bay leaves and peppercorns into a large pan or pot.  Bring to the boil, then reduce heat to a gentle simmer. Simmer until it reduces about two-thirds, stirring occasionally. Remove from the heat. Strain and let cool. Add the cooled vinegar mixture to the mustard paste. Add salt and sugar to taste. Stir in the horseradish. Stir to combine. Let sit for 20 minutes. Pour the entire mixture into a clean pot or pan. Bring to a low simmer and allow to cook for 15 minutes. Remove from the heat. Cool slightly, then transfer to sterilized jars or bottles. Store in a cool, dry and dark place. This will keep for up to one year. Finished.
